citeinfo.origin: Fisheries and Oceans Canada - Ocean Science And Productivity, Pacific
citeinfo.title: Northwest Pacific Moored Sediment Trap Data - Russian Collaboration, 1991-1992

descript.abstract: Time series data from 3 moored sediment traps deployed in the NW Pacific Ocean in 1991-1992 at 4000-5000m. Collaborative data collected on Russian vessels.
descript.purpose: Biogeochemical flux in the deep ocean.
descript.supplinf: Risk Justification: Custodian will be leaving soon and has a large quantity of data not secured in a regional data centre. Risk of Loss: High Impact Justification: Does not affect a wide variety of users. Impact of Loss: Low Recommended Action: Bring data to archives. Additional Info: See also entry under, Northwest Pacific, 1991-1992 (GEMS); data from cruises to deploy and retrieve sediment traps. Four sediment traps were deployed; one did not work.

theme.themekey: Earth Science > Oceans > Ocean Chemistry > Biogeochemical Cycles
Earth Science > Oceans > Marine Sediments > Sediment Compostion

cntaddr.address: Institute of Ocean Sciences, P.O. Box 6000, 9860 West Saanich Road

dataqual.logic: For C:N, biogenic silicate, CaCO3: subsamples of one sample, collected at P26, are analyzed with each set of data to check for continuity. Zooplankton that likely swam into the trap are removed. Silicate concentrations are compared to prepared standards.
dataqual.complete: Electronic Data Complications: Lotus 1-2-3 spreadsheets should be converted to Excel

cntaddr.address: Institute of Ocean Sciences, P.O. Box 6000, 9860 West Saanich Road

stdorder.nondig: Hardcopy Original Exists: Y Hardcopy Locations: Janet Barwell-Clarke, Rm 1408, IOS Hardcopy Description: Binder of data sheets Hardcopy Volume: one 1 in. binder Physical Sample Exists: Y Physical Sample Locations: Janet Barwell-Clarke, Rm 1411, IOS Physical Sample Volume: about one hundred. Physical Sample Description: Vials of dried sediment in various formats: some are on filters, some are not.
